body.p: Select the name of the bone that is being described.
The articulates with the clavicle and humerus.
The helps to keep the shoulders in place; connects upper arm to the body.
The provides attachments for muscles that move the shoulder and the chest at the proximal end, and articulates with the radius and ulna.
The provides attachment for muscles that bend the arm at the elbow and ligaments that allow movement of the wrist.
The provides attachment for muscles that straighten the arm at the elbow and ligaments that allow movement of the wrist.
The connects the bones of the lower limbs to the axial skeleton.
The provides attachment for muscles of the lower limbs and buttocks; distal end articulates with the tibia.
The articulates with the fibula on the lateral side; articulates with the patella on the anterior side.
The forms the lateral part of the ankle joint .
The supports movement of the knee joint .

response.feedback: Correct. The scapula is located in the pectoral girdle.
Incorrect. The clavicle is located in the pectoral girdle.
Incorrect. The humerus is located in the upper limbs.
Incorrect. The radius is located in the upper limbs.
Incorrect. The ulna is located in the upper limbs.
Incorrect. The ilium is located in the pelvic girdle.
Incorrect. The femur is located in the lower limbs.
Incorrect. The tibia is located in the lower limbs.
Incorrect. The fibula is located in the lower limbs.
Incorrect. The patella is located in the lower limbs.

part.hint: This is located on the posterior side of each shoulder.
